official_title: Postdoctoral Fellow of Neural and Cognitive Sciences
bio:
Wenjia Zhang is a Postdoctoral fellow of Neural and Cognitive Sciences at NYU Shanghai. He obtained his PhD from the school of Psychology at South China Normal University, with researches investigated the neural representation of Chinese word category and basic composition relationship. At NYU Shanghai, he works with Professor Xing Tian on the different prediction streams during speech perception and production.

Research Interests

Speech and language

Education

  • PhD, Psychology, South China Normal University, 2017
  • Master, Psychology, South China Normal University, 2013
  • B.S, Applied Psychology, Anhui University, 2009.  

Languages

Chinese, English
